questions.question_text: Which code snippet prints the exception error message as part of the page output?

discussion.content: B is correct. D will print to system console, not to the page

choices.D: The transfer order is considered received and delivered at the time of shipment.
choices.B: There is no put away transaction in Inventory since the item is expensed.
choices.E: The destination inventory is not incremented.
choices.A: There is no cost associated to the transaction.
choices.C: A receipt is required on interorganization expense destination transfer orders between the from and to organizations.

questions.question_text: Which three statements are true for an expense destination transfers that does NOT require a receipt at destination inventory organization?

discussion.content: no sorry you are right, i re-read the article in the link, yes you are right !

Yes but only if you choose the option 'receipt required' if not required, the transfer is not considered received and delivered at the time of shipment 
https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/saas/supply-chain-management/20b/famml/transfer-orders.html#FAMML1985585 link
For non receipt expense destination transfers, the transfer order is considered received and delivered at the time of shipment.

questions.question_text: Java EE's support for WS-Security includes handling which two types of security credentials? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: A and B. (X 509, SAML Tokens, Kerberos Tickets, UserName Tokens)
Correct answers are A and B. You can check it in Oracle Java EE 7 Tutorial
